intro: Kyllinga melanosperma var. trispica, commonly known as blackseed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stem and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by dark, spherical berries. Its succulent leaves and stems store water, making it drought-tolerant. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
